agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: State Affairs TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, March 13, 2019 PLACE: E2.014 CHAIR: Rep. Dade Phelan HB 49 Larson | et al. Relating to daylight saving time. HB 853 Moody | et al. Relating to the deployment of advanced metering and meter information networks in certain areas outside of ERCOT. HB 985 Parker Relating to the effect of certain agreements with a collective bargaining organization on certain state-funded public work contracts. HB 986 Price | et al. Relating to the deployment of advanced metering and meter information networks by certain non-ERCOT utilities. HB 1128 Clardy Relating to the authority of the General Land Office to sell retail electric power. HB 1397 Phelan | et al. Relating to the establishment of rates for certain non-ERCOT utilities. HB 1550 Paddie Relating to certain governmental entities subject to the sunset review process. HB 1595 Paddie Relating to the deployment of advanced metering and meter information networks in certain areas outside of ERCOT. HB 1680 Paddie Relating to the sunset review process and certain governmental entities subject to that process. HB 1767 Murphy Relating to the consideration of employee compensation and benefits in establishing the rates of gas utilities. HB 2011 Geren Relating to the affordability of electric power for certain public retail customers. HB 2263 Paddie | et al. Relating to the sale of electric power to certain public customers. HJR 79 Klick Proposing a constitutional amendment authorizing legislative action at any time during a regular session of the legislature on a bill that extends the existence of an agency, commission, or advisory committee following legislative review. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
